Sp-U: Grasseed
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): The Shrine (Passwords and Unlocking): Special Breeds and Legendary Breeds: Sp-U: Grasseed
By GoldenBoy on Monday, August 4, 2003 - 03:02 pm:

Grasseed has been unlocked!
Done by Jimeous so long ago he forgot exactly how he did it, I took a shot and it worked.

1) Raise a Raiden
2) qualify and win all Death Blow tournies for C,B, and A ranks.
3) you will be given the password 1W0O0O0D (that's zero,letter o)

I will add a reminder schedule for Death Blows and an optimal plan of attack later tonight.

By GoldenBoy on Monday, August 4, 2003 - 08:40 pm:

This is a reminder chart for the dates and names of Death
Blow qualifiers, as well as invite dates.

RANKQ1Q2Q3Q4INVITEBATTLE
CFlower CupSummer ClassicWild CupCountdown Cup
Mar/4Jul/1Sep/2Dec/4Jan/1Feb/1
BStorm CupBrilliant 8Spartacus Cup
Sep/4Nov/1Mar/4Apr/2May/2
AStrike CupCorona ClassicMistral Cup
May/4Jul/2Jan/4Mar/2Apr/2


The dates in green are the dates I fought with my Raiden,
Dim Bwack. The only time I put him in lengthy storage was
between Spartacus and Storm Cups, and then from Storm
until the Death Blow. Time passes quickly if you go
exploring or Sparring with a more experienced monster and
save lifespan on your Raiden. However if you are using an
out of box Raiden, you may need chunks of that time for
training. Most of my training was done during the short
layovers, or while waiting for invites.

My stats were much higher than needed, but here is where I
ended up and it allowed me to beat Class A with ease.
Stats: 796/203/797/586/265/514
Char: Up Claws, Tuf Skin, Up Lgtng, Elite, Popular,
Charisma.

By GoldenBoy on Thursday, August 7, 2003 - 05:39 pm:

Dim Bwack is the product of two long breeding lines. He
wasn't an ideal combination, so he didn't get much in the
way of stats, but he started with 40 reliance, which meant I
could do hard drills right away. He is only 2y7m old at this
point, and only really hit his stride a few months ago. If I
needed to, I could easily max out 3-4 stats. As it is I'll
probably just combine him.

I'm not a big user of "method" ranching, so I can't describe
what I do. The biggest aids for me are top of the line items,
and a good bloodline. I don't use any tricks like the
nevertired method, I just reset the occasional failure.
